Concept Definition: The set of rules that specifying the user identities and their level of access (e.g. read, write, update) to the software.
Keep Concept?: n - has a repository specific implementation

Concept Definition: The institution, organization or other group that the software creator is associated with.
The email address associated with the creator of the software.
A universally unique character string that is associated with the software author, for example: “http://orcid.org/0000-0002-2192-403X”.
The name of the institution, organization, individuals or other entities that created the software.
A URL for the instructions to create an executable version of the software from source code.
A URL for the continuous integration system used to build the software automatically after updates to the source code repository.
An integer value indicating the number of times that the software has been cited.
A URL for the repository containing the software source files.
Keywords associated with the software (i.e. Fixed vocabulary by which to describe category or community of software)
The date that a published version of the software was created by the SoftwareAuthor.
The date that a published version of the software was updated by the SoftwareAuthor.
The date the software was first made available  publicly by the publisher.
The computer hardware and software required to run the software.
JavaScript package descption (npm): dependencies / devDependencies / peerDependencies / bundledDependencies / optionalDependencies / cpu / engines

Concept Definition: A text representation conveying the purpose and scope of the software.
A designation of the current state of the software in the development lifecycle, e.g. (“active”, “inactive”) or (“beta”, “candidate release”, “release”), etc.
An indication of the completeness of documentation that describes the installation, operation and intended usage of the software. This value is expressed as a percentage.
An integer value indicating the number of times that the software has been downloaded.
The URL to obtain the distribution of the software from.
A calendar date specifying the end of a restricted access period, i.e. the date that the software may be made publicly available.
The role or objective associated with the software.
Software Discovery Index: Terms to describe software objectives or functions

Concept Definition: An institution, organization or other entity that has provided monetary resources needed to develop, test, distribute and support the software.
This field indicates the thing that created this metadata record (could be person or tool?)
The authority from which the SoftwareIdentifier was created,  e.g. doi.org, or cran.r-project.org
Data, configuration or other types of objects used by the software.
Software Discovery Index: Formats for data inputs and outputs

Concept Definition: The category of users that the software was designed for.
Command-line v. GUI v. Excel...., Entry points
A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an update to the CodeRepository will trigger a new executable version of the software to be generated.
A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an agent (SoftwareAuthor, SoftwareContributor, etc) can be included in a citation of the software.
A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an agent (SoftwareAuthor, SoftwareContributor, etc.) is the active maintainer of the software
A logical value (true/false) indicating whether an agent Is the current agent the rights holder of the software
A URL for the issue tracking system used to report problems and request features, etc., for the software.
OntoSoft: sort of os:hasSoftwarefSupport (see Software Support below)

Concept Definition: A list of the specific counties or regions that the software has been adapted to, e.g. “en-GB,en-US,zh-CN,,zh-TW” (if using the ISO 639-1 standard codes).
The name of the license agreement governing the use and redistribution of the software. e.g. “Apache 2”, “GPL”, “LGPL”
The category of the resource (controlled list, such as software, paper, data, image…) that is associated with the software.
The computer system types that the software successfully operates on, i.e. “Mac OS X 10.5”, “Windows 7”
Data, graphics and other objects generated by usage of the software.
Software Discovery Index: Formats for data inputs and outputs

Concept Definition: Ask Zenodo what this is; may be the same as "DownloadLink" below
Keep Concept?: n - seems like a duplicate of downloadLink

Concept Definition: The computer language that the software is implemented with.
The institution, organization or other entity that makes a distributable version of the software publicly available.
A URL for the file that provides general information about the software.
The date that this metadata record describing the software was created
The date that  this metadata record describing the software was last modified
The date that the metadata record describing the software was published
A URL that provides additional information or resources related to the software.
Publications related to the software.
Relationship of the software to other related resources
The agent (person or organization) that created the software.
A text string that can be used to authoritatively cite the software from a published work, such as a research paper or  conference proceedings, etc.
The institutions, organizations, other groups or individuals, other that the author, that assisted in authoring, designing, testing etc., of the software.
A universally unique character string associated with the software.

A text string that can be used to authoritatively cite a research paper, conference proceedings or other scholarly work that describes the design, development, usage, significance or other aspect of the software.
The distinguishing name associated with the software.
External software components that could enhance operation of or enable advanced functionality of the software package but is not strictly required.
Terms used to describe the software that facilitate discovery of the software.
An indication of the completeness of testing methods (scripts, data, etc.) that verify the correct operation of the software. This value is expressed as a percentage.
Use Cases.x: 1, but missing use case to understand software quality/standing

Concept Definition: The user identity that uploaded the software to an online repository.
R Package Description: *Three letter code can specify other roles like author above: http://www.loc.gov/marc/relators/relaterm.html, https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2012-1/RJournal_2012-1_Hornik~et~al.pdf

Concept Definition: A unique string indicating a specific state of the software, i.e. an initial public release, an update or bug fix release, etc. No version format or schema is enforced for this value.
A URL for the software distribution in compressed form.
